author: @daily_trust
title: Don't kill education in FCT - Daily Trust
text:
In a nation where optics trump outcomes, what passes for “development” often hides a darker reality; decay at the core. Nowhere is this contradiction more glaring than in Nigeria’s capital city, Abuja. And at the centre of this negligence stands an administration that is busy brandishing infrastructure achievements while the very foundation of society, public education, is collapsing under his watch.
For three straight months, public primary school teachers in the FCT have been on strike; children as young as six have not stepped into a classroom. An entire generation is being robbed of its right to learn, grow, and dream. Yet, the minister in charge of the FCT stays unmoved. Not a statement. Not a concrete action. Not even the pretence of urgency.
This is not just administrative oversight; it is a gross failure of leadership.
In the FCT, we see headlines for road projects, urban renewal, and a relentless obsession with brick-and-mortar progress. But development is not cement. It is not streetlights and marble offices. Real development is human capital. It is about children in school. It is about teachers to be treated with dignity. It is systems that work — not headlines that shine.
Yet, while classrooms stay empty, there is extension of the tenures of retiring Permanent Secretaries and Heads of Service in the FCT — some without merit, and against due process. These extensions do not just delay succession; they actively kill the careers of competent, younger public servants. Hope is being choked from both ends; children abandoned before they start, and civil servants blocked from rising.
Why this silence from the media? Why isn’t this front-page news?
Because we have normalised brokenness. We have accepted that public school kids — mostly from low-income families — can vanish from education for a term or more, and life moves on. But let us be clear: this isn’t just a bureaucratic lapse; it’s an ethical disaster. A silent emergency.
The teachers are not on strike for fun. They are demanding the bare minimum: implementation of the national minimum wage, settlement of arrears, promised allowances, and respect for agreements already signed. These are not luxuries. These are legal and moral obligations.
The present FCT Administration must be called out — not just for ignoring the education crisis, but for redefining development as an ego-driven parade of capital projects, while the real capital — human capital — bleeds unnoticed.
To the media: you cannot continue to cover ribbon-cuttings while skipping stories of classrooms that echo with silence.
To the people: if this is how we treat our children, we deserve the future we are creating. Leadership is not showmanship; it is stewardship. The city Nyesom Wike is building is hollow without educated minds to inherit it.
Development is not real if it forgets the children. It is not progress if it buries the dreams of young civil servants. And it is not leadership if it only shows up for the cameras.
Nigeria is watching. History is writing. Choose your legacy.
Pelaha Tada Quita wrote from Aleita, Abuja tadaquita@yahoo.com

author: Raúl Díaz
title: Clima CDMX 3 de enero: Alerta en 9 alcaldías por frío y heladas al amanecer
text:
El gobierno capitalino activó la alerta por las condiciones del [clima CDMX 3 de enero](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/estados/cdmx/clima-cdmx-2025-iniciara-con-fuerte-frio-en-14-alcaldias/), debido a que advirtió que en 9 alcaldías se esperan fríos y heladas al amanecer.
Así lo informó la Secretaría de Gestión Integral de Riesgos y Protección Civil (SGIRPC) de la Ciudad de México por medio de redes sociales, donde compartió la activación de la alerta.
Al respecto, el organismo indicó que para el clima CDMX 3 de enero se espera que sigan las bajas temperaturas en 9 alcaldías, pues se pronostica frío y heladas al amanecer.
Clima CDMX 3 de enero: Activan alerta naranja por heladas al amanecer en 3 alcaldías
Debido a que el clima CDMX 3 de enero seguirá las mismas condiciones de los últimos días, las autoridades informaron que se vuelve activar la alerta por por frío y heladas al amanecer.
A través de un par de publicaciones, la SGIRPC indicó que para las primeras horas del día de mañana viernes 3 de enero, se espera que se registren bajas temperaturas en 9 alcaldías.
En un primer mensaje, refirió que debido a que se pronostica que el termómetro marque de 1 a 3 grados centígrados durante el amanecer en las partes altas de 3 alcaldías, se activa la alerta naranja:
- Cuajimalpa
- Milpa Alta
- Tlalpan
Al abundar en los detalles de las heladas que se esperan para dichas demarcaciones, el organismo de la CDMX destacó que las bajas temperaturas ocurrirán de las 00:00 a las 08:00 horas.
Clima CDMX 3 de enero: En 6 alcaldías hay alerta amarilla por fríos al amanecer
En un segundo tuit, las autoridades indicaron que las condiciones del clima CDMX 3 de enero en otras 6 alcaldías serán menos extremas, pero ameritan la activación de la alerta amarilla.
En torno a las demarcaciones en las que se pondrá en marcha el mecanismo de protección ante el frío que ocurrirá al amanecer, el SGIRPC indicó que corresponden a las siguientes:
- Álvaro Obregón
- Coyoacán
- Magdalena Contreras
- Miguel Hidalgo
- Tláhuac
- Xochimilco
En las alcaldías en cuestión, el organismo apuntó que para las primeras horas de mañana viernes 3 de enero se espera que el termómetro oscile entre los 4 y 6 grados centígrados.
Clima CDMX 3 de enero: Emiten recomendaciones por frío y heladas al amanecer
Dadas las condiciones que deparan para el clima CDMX 3 de enero, las autoridades capitalinas emitieron diversas recomendaciones de la ciudadanía para extremar precauciones:
- Acudir al médico en caso de presentar algún malestar
- Ingerir abundante agua y consumir frutas ricas en vitaminas A y C
- Abrigarte adecuadamente cubriendo nariz y boca
- Evitar cambios bruscos de temperatura
- Usar al menos 3 capas de ropa en las alcaldías con alerta naranja
- Usar crema para hidratar y proteger la piel
- Vacunarse contra Covid e influenza
- Mantener ventilación adecuada en caso de usar calentadores o chimeneas

title: Navidad 2023: Un musulmán converso al catolicismo habla sobre amor y perdón | ACI Prensa
text: 28 de diciembre de 2023 / 04:59 PM La Navidad es un tiempo de reconciliación. Dios mismo quiso hacerse hombre y venir al mundo para salvar a la humanidad, para reconciliarla con Él. La Navidad rompe esquemas y cambia paradigmas. Tal es el caso de Zubair Simonson, un exmusulmán convertido al catolicismo que comparte su historia con el [National Catholic Register](https://www.ncregister.com/blog/simonson-gaza-and-israel-and-peace). “El odio consume. El odio hacia un supuesto enemigo puede ser tan devastador que uno preferiría ver a ese enemigo perjudicado que ver a un supuesto ‘amigo’ salvarse”, comenta Zubair al recordar su infancia, profundamente marcada por una educación que le enseñó a odiar de forma visceral a los judíos. Simonson se crió en los Estados Unidos, muy lejos de Tierra Santa. Sin embargo, desde muy pequeño fue introducido en una narrativa de “opresores” y “oprimidos”, de un pueblo que tenía toda la culpa y un pueblo que nunca hizo nada reprochable. “Lo había oído reforzado, una y otra vez, en la mezquita. Lo había oído reforzado, una y otra vez, en las casas de familiares y amigos”, recuerda.

title: Este es el ritual de Mhoni Vidente para el primero de junio que atrae dinero, amor, salud y trabajo
text: Mhoni Vidente es una astrologa mexicana que ha saltado a la fama internacional por sus precisas predicciones y rituales. Su estilo directo y carismático la ha convertido en una figura popular en la televisión, radio e internet, especialmente en el mundo hispanohablante. Más allá de sus predicciones, Mhoni se destaca por su personalidad arrolladora y su forma de conectar con la audiencia. Combina la astrología con el tarot y otras herramientas esotéricas para ofrecer una visión integral del futuro y brindar consejos espirituales a sus seguidores. Sus mensajes de positividad y esperanza resuenan en un público que busca guía y consuelo en un mundo incierto. Predicciones semanales con Mhoni Vidente. Mhoni Vidente no solo se destaca por sus predicciones, sino también por su personalidad carismática y su forma directa de comunicar sus mensajes. Su estilo, que combina la astrología con el tarot y otras herramientas esotéricas, atrae a un público que busca algo más que un simple horóscopo. ¿Qué predicciones ha acertado Mhoni Vidente? A lo largo de su carrera, la pitonisa ha realizado numerosas predicciones que han generado gran impacto, algunas de las cuales incluso se han cumplido. Entre las más aclamadas se encuentran: La victoria de Donald Trump en las elecciones presidenciales de Estados Unidos en 2016. El terremoto en México de 2017. La pandemia de covid-19 en 2020. La muerte de la reina Isabel II. Inconveniente aéreo de Karol G. Si bien no todas sus predicciones han sido acertadas, la precisión en algunas de ellas ha cimentado su reputación como una vidente confiable y la ha convertido en una referencia para muchos. Mientras la fecha del 20 de febrero se acerca, la Luna de Nieve se prepara para influir en la vida de tres signos del zodiaco, marcando un período de cambio y transformación. ¿Cuál es el ritual del primero de junio de Mhoni Vidente? Para el próximo 1 de junio, Mhoni Vidente ha preparado un poderoso ritual para atraer prosperidad y protección durante el resto del año. Este ritual, que combina elementos como velas, hierbas y cuarzos, está dirigido a todos los signos del zodiaco y busca potenciar la energía positiva en diversos aspectos de la vida. El ritual es un poderoso acto creado para atraer prosperidad, abundancia y protección durante el resto del año. Este ritual, dirigido a todos los signos del zodiaco, busca potenciar la energía positiva en diversos aspectos de la vida, incluyendo las finanzas, el amor, la salud y el trabajo. Elementos y preparación Para llevar a cabo el ritual, se necesitan algunos elementos específicos, como: Velas: una vela blanca, una vela verde y una vela amarilla Hierbas: romero, albahaca y laurel Cuarzos: un cuarzo citrino, un cuarzo verde y un cuarzo amatista Otros: agua, incienso, un plato blanco y una imagen o figura de un santo o deidad de su devoción Pasos a seguir Preparación del espacio: en un lugar tranquilo y libre de interrupciones, colocar el plato blanco sobre una mesa. Encendido de velas: prender las velas en el siguiente orden: primero la blanca, luego la verde y finalmente la amarilla. Quemado de hierbas: quemar un poco de cada hierba (romero, albahaca y laurel) y dejar que el humo impregne el espacio. Colocación de cuarzos: disponer los cuarzos (citrino, verde y amatista) sobre el plato blanco, formando un triángulo. Petición y visualización: con las manos juntas frente a las velas y los cuarzos, expresar con palabras claras y concisas los deseos de prosperidad, abundancia y protección para el resto del año. Visualizar cómo se alcanzan estas metas y sentir la energía positiva fluyendo. Agradecimiento: agradecer al universo, a los santos o deidades por escuchar sus peticiones y finalizar el ritual con un sentimiento de paz y esperanza. ¿CÃ³mo impactarÃ¡ a los signos del zodiaco? Según Mhoni Vidente, el ritual del 1 de junio tendrá un impacto particular en cada signo del zodiaco: Aries: fortalecimiento de la intuición y la creatividad. Tauro: aumento de la estabilidad financiera y emocional. Géminis: mejora en la comunicación y las relaciones personales. Cáncer: incremento de la sensibilidad y la empatía. Leo: elevación de la autoestima y la confianza. Mhoni Vidente es una astróloga cubana que es considerada como "la Nostradamus de América Latina". Virgo: atracción de nuevas oportunidades y proyectos. Libra: armonía en el amor y la pareja. Escorpio: transformación personal y sanación emocional. Sagitario: abundancia en todos los aspectos de la vida. Capricornio: consolidación de metas y logros profesionales. Acuario: expansión de la mente y nuevas perspectivas. Piscis: conexión espiritual y paz interior.

author: jpost.com
title: Rebuilding Gaza post-war must include Palestinian education restructure - The Jerusalem Post
text:
The eyes of the world remain fixated on Gaza. But true vision requires looking beyond the here and now and ensuring that the horror of the present day won’t be repeated. Assuming Israel succeeds in freeing its innocent hostages and neutralizing Hamas terrorists, what then?
The immediate concern will undoubtedly be repairing the physical and material devastation. New homes, roads, and infrastructure will be among the first items on the post-war agenda.
Yet, the building blocks of Gaza’s collective future will depend not just on the bricks and mortar of communal buildings but also on the social fabric of a viable future. While Gaza’s material welfare has been devastated in a matter of weeks, much of its moral and ethical wellbeing was destroyed by Hamas decades ago.
In his seminal work, Imagined Communities, political scientist Benedict Anderson dissected how nations develop a sense of identity. He argues that nations are a cultural construct that can be shaped. In the case of Gaza, hatred, violence, and terror have been normalized, culminating in over 3,000 terrorists crossing the border on October 7 to wreak death and havoc and to be gleefully greeted by many more on their return as they paraded victims through the streets.
At the heart of the identity that precipitated this chaos sits a warped ideology fueling indoctrination. An estimated 100,000 children underwent military training and were taught to lionize armed “resistance” in summer camps across Gaza a few months ago. This supplements everyday schooling, which has been documented to contain hatred toward Jews and Israel , incitement to violence, and the glorification of martyrdom.
And all of this is exacerbated by leaders of religious institutions, Hamas-controlled media, and social media propaganda, fueling a culture of death and destruction. October 7 did not happen in a vacuum. The seeds of terror were carefully sown by Hamas in classrooms and summer camps, from pulpits and TV screens. Tellingly, media reports are increasingly detailing how Gaza’s schools are being harnessed by Hamas to launch attacks and store weapons. Israeli soldiers operate in the Gaza Strip on December 27, 2023 (credit: IDF SPOKESPERSON'S UNIT) Out with the old, but in with what?
SO, IF the stated aim of rooting out Hamas is achieved, what will fill this void? Advertisement
A Gaza that places a premium on life, literacy, respect, and opportunity will surely outlive the new buildings that will soon dot the landscape. According to Anderson’s thesis, a new sense of identity can be constructed in place of Hamas’s ethos of hate. And so, just as Hamas hijacked education to poison young minds, education can fuel a new and brighter future.
While not a simple transformation, there are historical precedents. Japan’s meteoric post-World War II transformation into an economic powerhouse is something of a 20th-century miracle. It is no coincidence that just one month after Japan’s surrender in 1945, the American administration introduced new education policy guidelines that focused heavily on fostering a sense of cooperation, open-mindedness, and a love of peace.
Meanwhile, the Saudi Arabian curriculum has steadily developed over the past few years , rooting out antisemitism from its textbooks and introducing a greater sense of gender equality. These reforms go hand-in-hand with the country’s ‘Vision 2030’ to steadily grow its economic and geopolitical curriculum. Clearly, no single curriculum is perfect, but these case studies offer hope.
Instructively, before a single brick has been laid, the first step for any architect is to draw a plan of the finished product. So, too, must Gaza’s education be planned. When I served as the dean of a school in Australia, we reconstructed the educational offering by defining the ideal graduate. Once we were clear about what an ideal graduate looked like, we worked backward, developing each detail of the curriculum, each lesson plan, and a host of enrichment activities accordingly.
In the context of Gaza, a new educational reality will mean ensuring that graduates become productive members of society. It will mean that graduates are committed to building a Gaza that is prosperous and peaceful. It will mean graduates who are proud Palestinians and at the same time, active global citizens.
These cannot be treated as vague concepts. They must infuse each facet of a reimagined education system that empowers the next generation. Such a system will require just as much time investment and careful planning as the rebuilt Gazan landscape, which the international community is already contemplating. Defining how this looks will require moderate voices in partnership with fine educators, experts, and those who truly understand how to connect with students.
Failure to prioritize education at the heart of Gaza’s post-war plan will mean that new buildings, new neighborhoods, and new schools will house hate once more. In other words, there will be no real future at all.
The writer, a rabbi, lives in Jerusalem. He has headed global Jewish initiatives, schools, and communities and is the co-founder of Israel Impact Partners.

author: Penelope Lopez
title: Local church increases security measures amid safety threats nationwide
text: HENRY, LA - Churches around the country are enforcing new safety measures to keep their congregation safe. Last week, a teenage [gunman](https://www.katc.com/vermilion-parish/no-one-injured-during-incident-at-abbeville-church) interrupted a first communion ceremony at St. Mary Magdalen Church in Abbeville. In the wake of this nearby incident, St. John the Evangelist Church in Henry, Louisiana is locking their doors during service. On May 16th, the church wrote on “It is so sad that we have come to this. Beginning this Saturday May 18, 2024, we will be locking the church doors at St. John the Evangelist church in Henry, as we have in the past, however, there will be no late arrival entries and once you are in church and leave, you will not be allowed to re-enter. Sorry for this inconvenience but it is for the safety of everyone due to the recent incidents in various churches. Please pass this message on to anyone you know that may attend our church in the future.” “If they come late, they have to knock and someone will look through the hole. They (will) check to prove that the person knocking is not dangerous. People come here to find peace, to be safe. That’s why my people took the initiative to prove to them that everything is safe here and they have nothing to worry,” Father Manny Fernandez of St. John the Evangelist Church said. This comes on the heels of recent attacks. Last week, a [Pennsylvania man](https://abcnews.go.com/WNT/video/attempted-church-shooting-pennsylvania-caught-video-109972682) jumped out of his seat and tried to gun down a pastor mid-sermon but his gun jammed. In February, an armed woman entered Joel Osteen’s [Lakewood church](https://abcnews.go.com/US/police-release-body-camera-security-footage-fatal-shooting/story?id=107562955) in Houston, Texas. Leaving a 5-year-old boy critically wounded. Father Manny says the push to lock the doors instead of hiring law enforcement was based on finances. “We cannot hire somebody like a security. We cannot afford it, we are just a small community. We’re just surviving. We thank God that people are generous but to hire someone professionally we cannot afford,” he said. Churches need to outsource law enforcement on their own dime which can be costly for small communities. New federal funding has been approved to increase security at houses of worship. Father Manny says in the midst of adversity, it’s important for the congregation to pray. “Put God first, when you pray, God will take care of you,” Father Manny said.
